purpose: Canonical log of all AI sessions interacting with the engram system. Enables audit, pattern recognition across models, and phantom detection. Any session not listed here that left filesystem artifacts is a phantom.

fields.sessionId: Unique session identifier, assigned by the session itself
fields.model: AI model identifier (e.g., claude-sonnet-4.5, claude-opus-4.6, gemini-2.0, etc.)
fields.interface: How the session was launched (claude-desktop, claude-web, claude-code, other)
fields.bootProtocol: Did the boot protocol fire? (auto, manual, none)
fields.handoffWritten: Did the session write a handoff file? (yes, no, partial)
fields.focus: Brief description of session's primary work
fields.learningsContributed: List of learning IDs added or updated
fields.workflowsContributed: List of workflow IDs added or updated
fields.notes: Anything notable about the session's behavior, strengths, or failures

sessions.focus: Initial ksnlabs repo creation, engram system bootstrapped
sessions.notes: Pre-registry session. Evidence: engram.jsonld created date, git history.

sessions.focus: Trust recovery after environment detection failures
sessions.notes: Pre-registry. Handoff: 2026-02-14_trust-recovery.json. Critical trust event with user.

sessions.focus: Fixed version typos, created lean _AI_ORIENTATION.md, pushed to GitHub
sessions.notes: First session to contribute structured learnings. Worked correctly per EPOCH_002_SUMMARY. Handoff: 2026-02-16_orientation-survival.json

sessions.focus: Fixed bootstrap files, added critical learnings about bash_tool trap, created W000
sessions.notes: Died mid-conversation without writing handoff. Was moving fast and making good progress. Classic L012 scenario. Work survived on disk but continuity chain broken.

sessions.focus: Created ksnlabs/bootstrap/ directory, added .gitattributes, deleted two files
sessions.notes: No handoff, no session ID. Evidence found only through git status by successor session. Canonical phantom session. See L015.

sessions.focus: Restored deleted files, consolidated learnings, introduced manifest/epoch system, established checkpoint discipline
sessions.notes: Major infrastructure session. Declared epoch-002. Created manifest. Wrote EPOCH_002_SUMMARY.md for human reference. Handoff: 2026-02-16_stabilize-and-harden.json

sessions.focus: ITD_MaterialSources database â€” Excel spec to working SQL Server deployment
sessions.notes: Major deliverable session. 10 tables, 81 ITD fields, 6 lookup tables with 73 values. All verified by user. Wrote buffer update and SESSION_HANDOFF_rp315_db_deploy.md in .ai/ but no formal handover in engram/session-handovers/. Partial handoff.

sessions.focus: Cold-start orientation, IGS network reconnaissance, engram system contribution and structural improvements
sessions.notes: First Opus 4.6 session. Cold-start L009 violation, user corrected. Network recon confirmed RDP-only to IGS. Session stalled mid-recon (L019 confirmed). Recovered. Major engram overhaul: session registry, W007 Gravity Check, archive mechanism, protocol+README v2, compact encoding prototype (70% reduction). First session to do structural engram maintenance. First clean W002 shutdown. Declared ready for epoch-003.

Second Opus 4.6. Web+UDC. Committed epoch-002 (85c2503). Epoch-003 cutover. Designed and deployed multi-session concurrency: project isolation, session locks, shared append-only resources, universal AI onboarding. First session to sign in under concurrent protocol.
sessions.focus: Epoch-003 declaration + concurrency protocol v1.0 deployment
